channel.title: Blog - As frankps sees the world!

item.title: Going Guadec
item.description: I will leave for my parents place this weekend and go to Guadec in Kristiansand on Monday.

item.title: Problems on Site
item.description: I have some problems with my site after using Moblogger. Some links have been broken and I have asked the Lifli crew to look in to it.

item.title: The First SIP Call from an Airplane
item.description: Michael Robertson of SIPphone.com recently published some cool news regarding VoIP...

item.title: SUSE 9.1 Personal Edition
item.description: I have downloaded the SUSE 9.1 Personal Edition ISO and is now ready to install it on my dual at home.

item.title: Adding newsfeeds to pages at work
item.description: Today I have been looking at adding newsfeeds to my works web pages.

item.title: Skype for Linux released
item.description: My favourite VoIP application Skype has today been released as a public beta for Linux.

item.title: Just bought my first digital camera
item.description: Yesterday I visited a photo expo down in the harbor area of Oslo and ended up buying my self a camera.

item.title: Living in an area with lots of access points?
item.description: I live in an area with several access points, and I'm from time to time running Windows XP from home. One of the first things that I noticed was that when the Wireless Zero Configuration (WZC) client in Windows XP is in the proximity of two wireless access points, and one of them is broadcasting its Service Set Identifier (SSID) and the other one not, your computer will always connect to the access point that is broadcasting its SSID. This occurs regardless of the preference order of the networks that are configured on the Preferred Networks list.

item.title: Telio with a Scandinavian flat rate
item.description: Telio will August 12th extend their free phone call offers to also include calls to Sweden and Denmark, as a Scandinavian flat rate.

item.title: New version of iBlog with moblogging support
item.description: I just had to buy moblogging support for my iBlog, and will be trying it out this summer from hotspots accross Norway and the various countries that I may visit this summer.

item.title: Surfs up!
item.description: The summer is here and you are afraid that you will not be able to surf as much as you do the rest of the year? Well, not from this summer and on, the area of Oslo, called Grünerløkka is getting wifi in the parks!

item.title: Freenet and Sipgate with one net
item.description: The Voice-over-IP suppliers Freenet and Sipgate are merging their nets together. Internet phone calls between the customers of these two companies will become free.

item.title: A new Voice-Over-IP solution sees the light
item.description: Popular Telephony Inc. on Wednesday announced Peerio444, a serverless Voice Over Internet Protocol (VoIP) communication product aimed at Mac, Windows and Linux users alike.

item.title: Some major features coming in Skype soon
item.description: I have just finished translating the latest version of Skype to Norwegian bokmål. From the strings that I translated, I could see that a major update is on it's way.

item.title: Telio and Sipgate has implemented so called "peering"
item.description: For Telio customers, like me, this means that we can call Sipgate users "end-to-end-IP" unlimited for free.
